page.title: 05THE VILLAGE SHOPKEEPER
page.content: SANDHURST VILLAGE SHOP The only shop in Sandhurst Village is at Box Cottage Nurseries, it is owned by Mr & Mrs Robinson. The building is very small, more like a little hut, and the Robinsons run it more as a hobby and as a convenience for the village residents. It is a place where people can call in for a chat and exchange village gossip. The shop sells sweets, ices and drinks for the village children. It keeps a small stock of tinned and packet foods which are mainly for Â£emergency' since most villagers do their weekly shopping in Gloucester. It also acts as the sub- post office for the local area. The Robinsons know a lot about the village and its residents but they may retire soon. Villagers are worried that when this happens no-one else will want to take on the little shop.
